means: 把…并列，把…并置，把…放在另一个旁边( juxtapose的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Interviews with politicians were juxtaposed with news items of quite astonishing triviality.
sentence.Network_cn: 对政治家的访谈与内容相当耸动的八卦新闻放在同一个版面。

sentence.Network_en: Contemporary photographs are juxtaposed with a sixteenth century, copper Portuguese mirror.
sentence.Network_cn: 几幅当代照片和一面16世纪的葡萄牙铜镜并排摆在一起。

sentence.Network_en: In the exhibition, abstract paintings are juxtaposed with shocking photographs.
sentence.Network_cn: 展览会上抽象画与令人震惊的照片并列展出。

entry.tran: （为强调不同点）把…并置，把…并列
entry.def: If you juxtapose two contrasting objects, images, or ideas, you place them together or describe them together, so that the differences between them are emphasized.

example.ex: The technique Mr Wilson uses most often is to juxtapose things for dramatic effect...
example.tran: 威尔逊先生最常用的手法是将事物放在一起，以产生戏剧化的效果。

example.ex: Contemporary photographs are juxtaposed with a sixteenth century, copper Portuguese mirror.
example.tran: 几幅当代照片和一面16世纪的葡萄牙铜镜并排摆在一起。

means.word_mean: 1. placed side by side often for comparison;

auth_sentence.content: Conservation of energy only has meaning when juxtaposed with time.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Conservation of energy only has meaning when juxtaposed with time.

auth_sentence.content: The self only comes to exist when juxtaposed with other people.
auth_sentence.res_content: The self only comes to exist when juxtaposed with other people.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The self only comes to exist when juxtaposed with other people.

auth_sentence.content: There are moments of assured clarity, juxtaposed with flashes of childlike shyness.
